name: Conrad Dublin

reviews.text: I stayed here the at the end of December and was disappointed in the condition of the hotel for a Conrad property. While the service was good my room seemed very dated and needed to be refurbished. The locaition is in a quiet area near St Stephens Green a 10 min walk to Grafton Street. I would not stay here again. It is expensive for the quality of the room and facilities. I stayed at the Westin Hotel a few days later and found it to be a supreme location and much nicer room/facilities. The Westin is also right in the middle of Dublin...walking distance to everything you want to see. I am a Hilton Diamonds member and would not return to this hotel
reviews.title: Quiet location good staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just came back from a lovely two days stay at the Conrad Hilton, everything was well above what I expected. The Room was clean and confortable, the bathroom luxurious and the bed divine.
reviews.title: Christsmas at the Conrad

reviews.text: The meals we took in the restaurant and the bar were outstanding and the staff were great fun.
reviews.title: Quality Hotel

likes.disliked: — No tea/coffee making facilities in room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for a weekend break with friends.
reviews.title: We loved it!

likes.liked: — You feel like you are being spolied!

reviews.text: Everything excellent, but particularly the attitude of the staff. Everyone we met was friendly, helpful and courteous.
reviews.title: Nice, but needs sound-proofing

likes.disliked: — noise - from next door normal level conversations and from street outside

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A warm selcome, great beds and a wonderful location across from St. Stephens Green all made for a very nice stay. The breakfast buffet was the best breakfast we had in all of Ireland.
reviews.title: Nice stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Arrived early so room not available. When we came back found out we were upgraded to a suite, not bad to say we were using HH points.
reviews.title: Enjoyable stay

reviews.text: Good location.
reviews.title: Business trip 36 h.

likes.disliked: — No coffee brewer or water boiler in the room with complimentary coffee or tea / Poor breakfast bufé

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked directly on Hiltons webpage, and there were only the smallest suites available, but the price was quite good anyway; £275. I choosed this hotel because I read good reviews here on tripadvisor and because it is so central, to fill my need when I just had 36 h. in Dublin for business. I wanted to look for some shopping at Grafton street and the luxury department store – Brown Thomas, which is actually not that good for men. Also, the LUAS train is very close by, just next to the park St. Stephen’s Green, which is just a 5 min walk from the hotel, in quick pace for European measure, took me to the Dundrum shopping center, which is quite good. A taxi from the aiport was just under €20. I had forgotten to ask for an early check-in and my room was not done when I arrived at around noon, and would have to wait until 3 p.m., nothing was offered to me as complimentary, as a Hilton Gold member and when booked a suite, I thought that was not that good of service from a fife star hotel. It was also poring down rain, so I had to direct eager to go out and do my shopping exactly, but had to do it anyway, instead of sitting in the bar for 3 hours.
reviews.title: Overpriced
Conrad Hotel, Wonderful Experience, Perfect
reviews.text: Location 9/10:

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here for one night in October 2008. Lovely hotel, pleasent staff, but not a 5 star hotel. The hotel was modern, and comfortable, and above all, quiet at night. Our room on the 4th floor, was nice enough, but nothing special. The view was terrible. It looked onto what looked like an office block behind. Nothing else was visible. Nice bathroom, and nice toiletries. For the price, 205 euros breakfast included would have been nice, but we had to pay another 24 euros each for breakfast. Pricey but nice, although we were not asked if we would like toast. We were nearly finished breakfast before we realised we could have had toast. Location was "just" ok. Nothing at all in the immediate area, but a pleasent 10 walk through St. Stephens Green to Grafton Street. O'Connell Street would be about 20 minutes walk without stopping. The hotel was a bit lacking in atmosphere which could have been easily remedied by bringing in a traditional music group or similar. I would rate this hotel a reasonable 4 star, but not a 5 star.
reviews.title: Not a 5 star

likes.disliked: — No atmosphere and location was slightly out of things.

reviews.text: When I booked this trip, there was a wide selection of upper-class hotels in Dublin and the decision was difficult to make. I chose the Conrad Dublin for several reasons: 1)got a good rate, 2) am a Hilton Honors member, and 3)good location. In retrospect, I wish we had stayed somewhere else. The hotel was very clean and the location was such that we could easily walk around to some of the attractions we wanted to see. When we arrived via taxi, there was no doorman available to see that our luggage was taken care of so we lugged heavy suitcases to the front desk. No mention was made of my being a Hilton Honors member nor were we given any extra amenities such as complimentary bottled water, etc. We snacked in the "pub" and it was the worst food we had on our entire trip to Ireland and we were in some pretty remote areas. Lastly, we came back to the lobby area for drinks on Saturday night. There was a 21st birthday party going on in the pub (downstairs from the lobby) and the noise was so bad, we didn't stay very long. I look forward to another trip to Dublin, but I won't be staying here.
reviews.title: Disappointed

likes.liked: — Free use of computers in business center, location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked this hotel via their own website after reading the reviews on tripadvisor. I wanted a romantic weekend as a surprise birthday present for my husband. It was an easy trip from the airport catching the Aircoach Sandyford route. The bus stop was just around the corner from the hotel which was ideal. On arrival, check in was easy but there was nothing special for HHonours members. I had booked a deluxe room with breakfast included and had asked for a quiet room on a high floor so I was a bit disappointed to be given a room at the front of the hotel overlooking the National Concert Hall on the 3rd floor. However, it turned out to be a lovely bright, airey and quiet room, spotlessly clean with a very comfortable huge bed. The bathroom was very spacious although the shower was over the bath but ample Moulton Brown toiletries. The hotel offered a turn down service at night which was lovely to come into after a long tiring day. There were bathrobes and slippers to use so all in all the room was extremely comfortable. Unfortunately, the hotel itself lacked atmosphere, especially in the bar/lounge area. Even a bit of music might have helped - afterall it is Ireland. Breakfast was good and plentiful and certainly set us up for the day so I would recommend a package including breakfast as if bought separately it cost 24 euros per head. We didn't eat at the hotel as there are plenty of very good restaurants around, although quite expensive. Our favourite is Harrys Cafe on Dawson street, its quite small and cosy but the food is lovely and there is a lovely ambiance about the place. We did the usual tourist trip on the hop on, hop off bus and got off at the Jail for a look around. There was a free tour which was very moving and interesting - this was certainly worth the trip. We also caught the DART train from Pearce Street station down south along the coast, which was amazing. Overall we had a wonderful weekend and the hotel was really convenient. However, it could have been anywhere and totally lacked any atmosphere. Would recommend for business but not really a romantic break.
reviews.title: Pleasant stay but hotel lacked atmosphere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were moved here when our original hotel was fully booked (The Drury Court). We were originally pleased to be moving from a 3* to 5* but were a little disappointed. They originally gave us a smoking room which we refused to take and eventually took another room on the smoking floor which was fine.
reviews.title: 5* - not really!
Pleasant stay at the Conrad
reviews.text: We had no problem with the hotel as the staff, rooms and breakfast were fine - not 5*. It is a business hotel not really for tourists. We have stayed in better 4* star hotels. Two nights later we returned to Dublin and stayed in The Westbury - a true 5* hotel.

I have just returned from a weekend in Dublin i found the conrad to be a lovely hotel the staff were really helpful the rooms were very comfortable spotlessly clean and well appointed as a smoker i was delighted to find myself in a smoking room and the buffet breakfast was plentifull hot and fresh overall i found the whole experience very pleasing and i will definatly be back planning my next trip for early next year
reviews.title: Conrad Is Tops For Scousers

reviews.text: We enjoyed our three day stay at the Conrad. The hotel is very nice and the location is great. I would say the service we experienced was very good. We were traveling with our 4 year-old and the staff gave him extra attention (from riding him on the luggage cart to putting his new toy together since we didn't have the necessary tools). I was very pleased with the stay and we will return on our next trip to Dublin.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel and Good Service

reviews.text: The rooms at this hotel are indicative of a four-star hotel, on the small side, but nicely appointed, clean and functional. The location is excellent, near St. Stephen Green and Grafton St. However, the service only merits a three star rating, I say this absolutely objectively, and not from malice or anger.
reviews.title: NOT a five star hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had stayed at this hotel previously, and found it to be outstanding (over 5 years ago), unfortunately, the property has not been updated in that time, and the front desk staff has transitioned to a largely Eastern European group, which presents a language barrier. I firmly believe that it is incumbent upon the tourist to familiarize him/herself with the language of the destination. However, if that language happens to be English, then the staff should extend the same formality.
reviews.title: Extremely Disappointing

reviews.text: I arrived at this hotel with my mother on the last day of a European trip, stopping in Ireland only overnight to catch a flight home to the US. We arrived at approximately 10:00 PM, and were dropped off by taxi in front of the hotel. We were not immediately greeted by a bellman, but one did notice us struggling up the stairs with baggage and came out to assist. He took our bags without awaiting instructions and disappeared inside while we checked-in. As I was offering my credit card for check-in I heard my bag fall over and the tinkle of broken glass. Two inexpensive, but sentimental souvenirs from Spain had been broken. A truly five-star hotel would make every effort to replace the items, even if it meant contacting a sister property in the country of origin; the manager on duty was only able to deduct 20 euros from our stay for the actual monetary value of the items. I am disappointed, frustrated and feel very unappreciated as a TEN YEAR HH Diamond member.
reviews.title: Nice, but don't expect above and beyond

description: The Conrad Dublin is part of Conrad Hotels & Resorts the Contemporary Luxury Brand of Hilton Worldwide. Conrad Dublin is a 5* luxury hotel located in the heart of Dublin city centre, just opposite the National Concert Hall and around the corner from beautiful St. Stephens Green. The famous Grafton Street, popular with shopping enthusiasts, is only a few minutes walk. For visitors interested in cultural activities, Trinity College, The National Art Gallery, The National Museum and Georgian Dublin are in the immediate vicinity. Hotel is also ideally located for sport lovers, with great golf courses such as Portmarnock, Killeen Castle (host of the 2011 Solheim Cup) and Royal Dublin only a 30-minute drive away.The Conrad Dublin is also within easy walking distance of Merrion Row, Dawson Street, and Temple Bar, which are just three of the main areas for nightlife that includes interesting pubs, clubs and restaurants that feature everything from two star Michelin Restaurants to relaxed casual dining and Gastro Pubs.
